alert.note: Alert for Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:04PM EST until January 09 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Surry County in northwestern North Carolina... Wilkes County in northwestern North Carolina... Yadkin County in northwestern North Carolina... * Until 715 PM EST Tuesday. * At 104 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible through 3 pm in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Wilkesboro... Elkin... Wilkesboro... Fairview... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Dobson... This includes the following streams and drainages... Ararat River, Beaverdam Creek, Arnold Branch, Beaver Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek, Basin Creek and Bee Tree Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
